alert.note: Alert for Barnes (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 17 at 10:22AM CDT until May 21 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota... Sheyenne River at Valley City affecting Barnes County. .USACE planning cuts at Baldhill. Currently in Valley City the river levels have crested within moderate and are looking to start dropping throughout the week. Chance for precip Thursday, with extra rainfall possible. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sheyenne River at Valley City. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, MAJOR FLOOD. Levees and low spots are re-enforced. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 16.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CDT Tuesday was 16.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Thursday evening and continue falling to 12.7 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
